page.title: 13Religion
page.content: There is a ring of six bells; the five bells which existed in 1906 plus a quart was turned. All of the bells were restored and rehung on ball bearings in 1955. The Nave and Chancel are 14th century although the western arch in the South arcade is 15th century, the South aisle was widened in the 14th century. The North aisle was widened in the 15th century. The Nave has a lead roof which is supported by 14th century corbets on each side. Some treasures of the church are a set of handbells which are preserved in the tower with a stained glass window dated 1852. Other treasures include 16th century chalice and records dating back to 1651.
